long_desc.thetext: Debugging failed test runs is frustrating because any errors, debug messages and all Selenium RC server log messages are dumped to STDOUT/STDERR. Writing log output to multiple files depending on its origin and differentiating between info/debug and warning/error messages would make things easier.
The log output of the test script itself can now be routed to a file specified in testConf['testLog'].

* The test controller class now logs everything it does to a file. Its location is specified in testConf['testLogDir']. A new file is created for each test run with the run's start date in the file name.
* The actual test runs (Simulations) now log to a local file as well as to the Selenium RC server's log file. Test reports are generated from these files, with the server log as a fallback.
Additional logging for tests of a local qooxdoo checkout:
* Output from batbuild.py (errors during SVN update or application build) is logged to files saved in the directory configured in buildConf['buildLogDir']. A new file is created for each build target.
* The build status (the trunk's SVN revision number at the time generation was started and any build errors) is also saved as a JSON file in the local trunk checkout's qooxdoo root directory. Remote test runs read this file in order to determine whether the application they're about to test has been built correctly.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
